entry.title: Re: Multitenant SaaS applications on SAP BTP using CAP? SAP BTP, Kyma Runtime!
entry.content:
Hi maxi1555_2022,

I'll invite gregorw to chime in here with his experience about whether multi-tenancy is supported for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Fastest way to download 20 million records as a file
entry.content:
Hi Naga,

What is the business purpose of downloading a file with 20 million records? What does the business user do with such a large file after downloading?

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: What You Need to Know to Prepare for the Community Migration Starting January 16
entry.content:
Will bookmarks be migrated from the current platform to the groups platform?  I expect many community members, including myself, have used the bookmark feature in the community.sap.com platform to easily keep track of blogs for reference.  I hope these bookmarks will not be lost in the migration.  Please confirm.

Thank you,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Extracted SAP Ariba Analytical Reporting API Data Using SAP Integration Suite and Imported into SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Tuncay,

In answer to your question, "Is Is SAP Integration Suite a feasible tool for this mission", it seems like quite a bit of effort and intricacy for a solution that still has gaps as pointed out in the Observations section.  I think this is a good case for undertaking a buy vs build analysis, where you could consider a purpose-built 3rd-party product like Precog which directly integrates Ariba and Datasphere.

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: “Plan-To-Action” in Workforce Management, with decentralized approval logic using BTP Build Proc
entry.content:
Hi @PatrickFavre,

One very important aspect that is missing from this example is showing an approach for approver (or agent) determination.  In a real world scenario, the business rules for determining the approver can be quite complex, so an example of how to address this with the capabilities of SAP Build Process Automation would make for a more comprehensive solution example. 

Regards,
Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Learn how to configure SAP Build Process Automation tasks for SAP Task Center
entry.content:
Hi @Chaitanya_Priya,

Regarding the statement "Tasks can only be opened within the My Inbox of the default site", does this mean that even when using Task Centre, there is still a dependency on the My Inbox app?  i.e. Task Centre cannot be used without the My Inbox app, is that right?

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Join the Livestream of Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Forum
entry.content: Are you aware that the link to the SharePoint site requires an SAP login?  Is that intended or is the site supposed to be public?

entry.title: Re: A new common place to find SAP Reference architecture diagrams from the community
entry.content:
Hi @UxKjaer,

Rather than providing multiple places to search for reference architectures, I would suggest that if possible, it would make more sense to use this new GitHub site to complement the Discovery Centre by enabling the contribution pipelines to also update the Discovery Centre Reference Architectures Catalogue.

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Cloud Integration - How to Manage Abnormally Large Files with SFTP Adapter and SAP HANA Database
entry.content:
Hi @fellipe_mendes,

For the reference of readers, a similar approach for SAP HANA Cloud as the target database has previously been documented in the blog post Integrate Large Data Sets from Flat File to SAP HANA Cloud using SAP IS JDBC Adapter by @asoni.

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Sharing SAP HANA Cloud instance to multiple subaccounts and creating HDI containers
entry.content:
Hi @KazuhikoTakata,

You've certainly addressed a very valid scenario to optimise SAP HANA Cloud subscription costs between development and test environments.  This is also valid for production environments where for example CAP applications are developed in different production subaccounts for different business domains and there is a desire to share and consume common services such as SAP HANA Cloud from a single subaccount.  Have you experienced this latter scenario?

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Is there an API for maintaining Decisions in SAP Build Process Automation?
entry.content:
SAP Build Process Automation currently provides an API to invoke Decisions, which enables a Decision to be consumed from an application, such as a CAP or UI5 application. 

I would like to know if an API is available to maintain Decisions?  The use case is to allow business users to maintain the business rule entries in a Decision Table from a custom Fiori/UI5 app to provide a purpose-built user experience rather than exposing the SAP Build Process Automation Cloud Studio Decision Builder UI directly to business users.

I thought I saw this as an upcoming feature on the SBPA Road Map but its seems to have dropped off.  Any insights would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Is there an API for maintaining Decisions in SAP Buil...
entry.content:
Hi @Ivan-Mirisola, 

Thanks for the fast response.  The Rules API you have referenced appears to be for the Business Rules capability associated with the deprecated SAP Workflow Management service.  I am looking for an equivalent API for the successor, which is the Decisions capability in SAP Build Process Automation.

As for the use case for maintaining Decisions, keep in mind that Decisions do not have to be consumed/embedded directly in a workflow.  They can be consumed independently by any custom application that needs a business rule capability, using the Invoke Rule Service API.  For such a use case, it is a common requirement to provide a UI to maintain the business rules like this example, where the structure of the business rule/decision table is not changed but the user is able to change the values of the fields or add new rows when business requirements change.  This way, business users have the ability to configure the business logic of the application, without the need for modifying the coding of the application logic.

More specifically, examples of use cases for maintaining Decisions (Business Rules) via API are as follows:
1)  Embedded Business Rules (Decision Tables) in a SaaS application UI.
2)  Back-end Business Logic for Fiori Extension Applications and Line-of-Business Smart Process Applications as described in Usage Scenarios.

So in the above context, is the API you have suggested also applicable to SAP Build Process Automation Decisions/Business Rules?

Regards,
Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Is there an API for maintaining Decisions in SAP Buil...
entry.content:
Hi @Ivan-Mirisola,

Thanks so much for the detailed analysis.  This makes things very interesting indeed.  My only concern now is that even if the Rule Authoring API for Cloud Foundry may work technically for maintaining SBPA Decisions, because it is still classified under the old SAP Workflow Management service in the documentation, I wonder if the use of this API with SBPA would be officially supported by SAP?  Do you have a view on this?

Regards,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Is there an API for maintaining Decisions in SAP Buil...
entry.content:
Hi @Archana,

Thanks for your feedback. A couple of questions:

1) The RuleBuilder SAPUI5 control already exists. How will the one you mention be different?

2) Even with the RuleBuilder control, we would still need an API to manage rules, for example to retrieve a list of rules that would be displayed in a List Report for a user to select and then edit in a detail page that contains the RuleBuilder control. Will a rule authoring API for newly created Decisions be made available as well?

Regards,
Mustafa.

entry.title: Has the SAP Master Data Integration service been deprecated?
entry.content: The SAP Master Data Integration service is no longer available in the SAP Discovery Centre Service Catalogue.  Has it been deprecated?

entry.title: What are the best practices for accessing files on an SAP S/4HANA system from SAP Cloud Integration?
entry.content:
Dear Community,

Variations of this question have been asked before in the Community.  However, I would like to be more specific and request your feedback based on latest experiences.

Context
There are scenarios where due to legacy system requirements, files must be output from an SAP S/4HANA system and integrated with the legacy system via SAP Integration Suite (SAP Cloud Integration).  In my case, the system is SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition.

The classic approach is for files to be output to an AL11 directory, in which case SAP Note 3343395 - FAQ: How to connect Cloud Integration to T-code AL11 recommends:

"Cloud Integration cannot directly connect to T-code AL11.
Your System Administrator / Integration Developer should set up FTP or SFTP service, for Cloud Integration to consume the file repository."

Solution Options
The following proposals have been suggested to address the requirement:

1.  Set up / co-deploy an SFTP server directly on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Server.

2.  Store the file object in the SAP TemSe Data Storage and expose an OData API that reads Temse data storage so that it can be consumed by SAP Cloud Integration to access the file object, thereby avoiding the need for setting up an SFTP server.

3.  Wait for the SAP Integration Edge Cell File Adapter planned for Q1 2025.

I would very much appreciate your experiences and recommendations on this topic.

Thanks,

Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: What are the best practices for accessing files on an...
entry.content:
@Ryan-Crosby,

Thanks for the fast response.  A couple of questions for clarification:
1)  Is your system SAP S/4HANA on-premise or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition?
2)  For which scenarios are you outputting files from SAP S/4HANA?

entry.title: Re: Communication Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition via APIs
entry.content: This is certainly a long awaited capability, which I think could be particularly beneficial for automating integration of partner products.  Will this S/4HANA Cloud API feature also be available for the Private Edition?
